bow: nanny for year old and do know how to deal with the crumbling family dynamic of the parents not sure if this is the right place to post this but wasn confident that the majority of commenters on relationships would be helpful ve been full time nannying my friends yr old son since last november the mom had extreme difficulty conceiving and it was long upsetting and expensive process her husband was ambivalent about having kids and it was difficult to get him to be supportive of her throughout that process ve heard rumors that if they didn have this kid that she was going to leave him the birth was difficult and the baby was weeks premature so he has some developmental delays but he happy and healthy kid since ve been nannying for them ve been told explicitly by the father that he is not interested in raising his son that maybe when he older he ll be more interesting to him he tells his son so happy to see you not just have to say that and bunch of other shocking and upsetting things he doesn read to him or feed him or notice him unless he absolutely has to or feels like he needs to keep up appearances both parents and had group communication channel which he has left because he doesn like answering questions and he became so hostile to me every time asked or mentioned his son that became hesitant to talk to him about anything baby related didn allow him to intimidate me with his anger and confronted him about it and he apologized and said that his wife is used to it but haven been privy to it until started nannying and that no excuse and he sorry can imagine what she endures in private the mom is basically single mother which would be difficult enough but out of resentment the father deliberately tries to undermine her and my efforts to nurture him and keep him safe yesterday he unplugged the crib camera so the mom couldn see that he left the baby in there all morning and said that the baby unplugged it impossible the baby also started crawling forward this week and both me and the mom want to childproof the play space put gates up remove or gate glass coffee table and he fighting her on it lying to me about planning to do it he also told me earlier this week that he already banged his head on it several times which means he watching him crawl over to it and not stopping him before anyone says she should leave divorce him want to make it clear that before the kid they went to counseling and almost split up and didn really truly doubt that she will leave him so trying to come up with more moderate way of supporting empowering her and ensuring that the dad doesn undermine the safety development of his son also get the impression from the other moms in our circle that the dad ambivalence and negligence while super obnoxious isn exactly uncommon how concerned should be he clearly emotionally abusing his wife but by most standards between the mom and my care the baby is fine if this were my partner would be beside myself but would also never have child with someone who was so blatantly and admittedly immature and disinterested any advice tl dr nanny for baby with negligent immature needy father and his resigned exhausted and depressed wife hard to witness even harder to help think his behavior is alarming and don know any dad that behaves in this way personally would start looking for another position this is an unhealthy environment and it not fair or you to have to deal with these sorts of issues and be put in the middle of the parents squabbles mom needs to leave this jerk period also most babies born at 36 weeks aren this delayed my daughter was born at 37 weeks and consistently ahead of every milestone she was walking by 10 months be worried he isn getting the proper attention when you aren there the reality is that you have no say in how that father parents his child you can decide if you are able to do your job in that reality and if not you can leave that job you can be source of support and positivity for your friend those are all of your available options think like you said you would have married and procreated with this guy but your friend made is making different choices and they re hers to make what does she want to do cps ll also chime in with the fact that have somewhat ambivalent husband he wanted our child but was caught very off guard by how much work they are some of the things you mention are think normal for men that sometimes they do really connect with children until they re older my husband does really read or interact one on one with our child unless out of the house put another way if at home am the parent and he off doing his own thing but he would *never* harm our child ever physically or emotionally our child is 17mo and he understands so much at this age already he does even talk yet and he understands stuff so this guy telling his own child that he not happy to see him and the other shocking and or upsetting things sure the child can pick up on that so you ve got problems with anger emotional abuse parental neglect leaving the child in the crib all morning or watching the child hit his head multiple times and not intervening would agree that think you need to have conversation with mom perhaps direct her towards http www thehotline org if she not willing to listen to you consider contacting cps only you know the full picture you re seeing this is really tough and frankly heartbreaking situation fully understand your desire to help this little boy but the fact of the matter is that something has to give with his parents for anything to truly change if you feel it necessary you can possibly force change by calling cps don know that they ll do anything though don know that they won either also want to stress that it is *not* normal for dad to act this way even dad who didn necessarily want children he needs to grow the fuck up excuse my french if he really didn want children he could have and should have refused but he allowed this to happen so he can either step up and be father or he can leave he can not abuse this poor baby and his mother that simply not viable option have you talked to your friend about his behavior and how alarming it is is their sons doctor not concerned that he just now crawling 36 weeks is not really *that* early and can imagine he should be this far behind work with families the hardest lesson to learn is that we ca help people who do want our help we ca force people to change no matter how good our advice may be if someone comes to us and is open to help and change that one thing but otherwise sometimes all we can do is listen and say wow that really sucks when working with kids whose parents exhibit toxic behaviors like this in front of them do not underestimate the power of modeling emotional regulation for the child if it happens in front of you it happens when you re gone x10 showing the child your dad is being mean and scary but do have to let it affect me is powerful be source of calm stability for the kid that the best thing you can do also if you see physical abuse negligence drug use criminal activity etc happen in front of or to the child that is reportable to child protective services emotional abuse is really hard to report but you can try to call on it any way this man is abusive he letting down his guard around you because he becoming comfortable with you there my soon to be ex brother in law is one of these recommend reading why does he do that and helping her get free before you make decision on what path you want to take currently going on year 10 watching my sister nieces go through this if you ever need to talk vent it long hard process but there is hope check out domesticviolence too yes hopefully op will take this seriously what want to know is why he purposefully putting the child in danger undermining the work the mom does what sane person unplugs baby monitor on purpose that so beyond just being meh have baby and makes me feel his issues are more than just being immature that dangerous hopefully the mom will figure out that she can do it better on her own based on your story above it good you re there to support the mom but she is also enabling the husbands behavior by not setting consequences to dangerous actions don understand why she doesn do more based on what you ve shared more likely that the poor treatment if not injuries caused this it really quite evil it almost like he trying to kill his child through neglect really hope what you said about this behavior being and this is extremely difficult to read in some alternate world your friend would not have been immature enough to force someone who actively rejects fatherhood to be father you do owe your friend an honest but try to keep the pressure and drama down discussion about the harm she is exposing her child to and that you ca enable this abuse she needs to internalize that this is more than about her feelings it about safe place for her child to live it unlikely that she will make any changes but make it clear that you offer her your wholehearted support should she make decision to leave on the outside people underestimate how difficult it is to divorce legally and financially personally would document as much as possible privately call cps and make sure that what you have written here ends up in report realize that this will almost certainly get you reprisals from the father so keep that in mind and prepare accordingly if you go through it agreed when kids are this far behind on milestones crawling only at age1 it warrants more examination remember seeing in the hospital month old who was sitting and it turned out that he had shaken baby syndrome from negligent caregiver think that his behaviour is neglectful and abusive and creates an unsafe environment for the child so agree with reporting to children safety authorities in the area if this were an official daycare to report and hope for everyone involved that the op does cps is often given bad rap but they re there to help that not delay it perfectly normal to start walking after 12 months but if there are real morning when his father is watching him he gets very little attention if any his mom gives him attention but she prefers to hold him and does really let him figure stuff out on his own based on my observations she also works after office hours usually while they re spending time together do know what this looks like because not present but know she certainly trying her best she probably just totally overwhelmed and does have time to do the research to make sure he getting the right kind of nurturing really do know this is how ve been consoling myself ultimately all can do is my best and
